article_title: National hospital ratings send conflicting messages
article_text:
National hospital ratings send conflicting messages Close study of four major hospital ratings shows broad disagreement

Photo: D. Fahleson, Staff LBJ Hospital, 5656 Kelley, Houston

Do you shop around for the best hospital? Do you find that hospitals are competing for your business because you have good insurance?

og.description: Hospitals are beginning to compete for business, particularly from patients with good insurance. To help consumers choose the best hospital, there are four major ratings: U.S. News & World Report's Best Hospitals; HealthGrades' America's 100 Best Hospitals; Leapfrog's Hospital Safety Score; and Consumer Reports' Health Safety Score. An academic study of these ratings, though, shows that they don't agree and can send confusing signals to patients looking for the best hospital for them.
